case_count_quote: Two cases comprised the study group.
patient_sex_quote: One woman (Case 1) received a male lung allograft [...] the other (Case 2) was a male recipient of a female lung allograft
presenting_symptoms_quote: Minute pulmonary meningothelial-like nodules (MPMNs) are asymptomatic small nodules representing incidental microscopic findings in lung specimens.
diagnostic_method: Transbronchial biopsy with XY chromosome in situ hybridization
diagnostic_method_quote: Dual-color fluorescence in situ hybridization for the sex chromosomes was performed using an X/Y direct labeled probe (Abbott Molecular, Des Plaines, IL)
histopathology: Nests or whorls of moderately sized epithelioid cells centered on small veins with elongated or spindled cells, oval nuclei, fine granular chromatin and inconspicuous nucleoli, with abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm showing poorly defined cell borders
histopathology_quote: Microscopically, the lesions consist of nests or whorls of moderately sized epithelioid cells centered on small veins with the cells being elongated or spindled with oval nuclei, fine granular chromatin and inconspicuous nucleoli, with abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm showing poorly defined cell borders.
immunohistochemistry: Positive for epithelial membrane antigen and vimentin; negative for cytokeratin, actin, S100 protein, CD34, chromogranin, synaptophysin, and CD68
immunohistochemistry_quote: On the basis of immunohistochemical stains, primarily positivity for epithelial membrane antigen and vimentin, and negative studies for cytokeratin, actin, S100 protein, CD34, chromogranin and synaptophysin [...] Immunostains showed the MPMN cells to stain for epithelial membrane antigen and vimentin and to not express CD68, a histiocytic marker.
outcome: Identified at 1.1 years and 10.5 years post-transplant respectively
outcome_quote: One woman (Case 1) received a male lung allograft for idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis and had MPMN identified at 1.1 years post-transplant; the other (Case 2) was a male recipient of a female lung allograft for severe smoking-induced bronchiolitis obliterans and had MPMN identified 10.5 years post-transplant.
comorbidities: Case 1: idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis; Case 2: severe smoking-induced bronchiolitis obliterans
comorbidities_quote: One woman (Case 1) received a male lung allograft for idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis [...] the other (Case 2) was a male recipient of a female lung allograft for severe smoking-induced bronchiolitis obliterans
filename: Luvison et al. - 2013 - Pulmonary meningothelial-like nodules are of donor origin in lung allografts.pdf
extraction_notes: The paper provides detailed clinical, histological, and immunohistochemical findings for two cases of MPMNs in lung transplant recipients. Most required fields are well documented with direct quotes, though patient ages are not mentioned.

case_count_quote: Here, we present a case of diagnostic dilemma
presenting_symptoms_quote: diagnosed with diffuse pulmonary nodules incidentally via CT angiogram chest during inpatient admission for COVID-19 infection
diagnostic_method: bronchoscopy with bronchioalveolar lavage (BAL) with transbronchial cryo biopsy
diagnostic_method_quote: The patient eventually underwent bronchoscopy with bronchioalveolar lavage (BAL) with transbronchial cryo biopsy of lung nodules
imaging_findings: numerous sub 6 mm bilateral centrilobular ground glass nodules (GGNs) and solid pulmonary nodules with mild upper lobe predominance
imaging_findings_quote: a follow-up CT scan chest 1 year later showed numerous sub 6 mm bilateral centrilobular GGNs and solid pulmonary nodules with mild upper lobe predominance
histopathology_quote: showed MPMNs with further immunostaining negative for malignancy
immunohistochemistry_quote: showed MPMNs with further immunostaining negative for malignancy
treatment_quote: given the complexity of the case, lack of symptoms, and stability of nodules, a decision was made for close follow-up with serial CT scans
comorbidities: ductal hyperplasia of the breast, common variable immunodeficiency syndrome (CVID), asthma, obstructive sleep apnea, thyroid follicular cancer, COVID-19 infection
comorbidities_quote: with a history of ductal hyperplasia of the breast, common variable immunode /uniFB01 ciency syndrome (CVID), asthma, obstructive sleep apnea, and thyroid follicular cancer
filename: Virk et al. - 2023 - RIDDLE ME THIS A RARE CASE OF DIFFUSE PULMONARY MENINGIOTHELIOMAS.pdf
extraction_notes: The case is well documented with clear presentation of patient characteristics, diagnostic workup, and management. The only slight uncertainty is in the long-term outcome as the case appears to be still under follow-up.

case_count_quote: We describe a patient with MPMNs and adenocarcinoma of the lung
patient_age_quote: A2-cm pulmonary nodule was incidentally discovered on screening chest radiographs in a 55-year-old nonsmoking Japanese woman
patient_sex_quote: A2-cm pulmonary nodule was incidentally discovered on screening chest radiographs in a 55-year-old nonsmoking Japanese woman
presenting_symptoms_quote: A2-cm pulmonary nodule was incidentally discovered on screening chest radiographs
diagnostic_method: CT, HRCT, fiberoptic bronchoscopy with cytology, surgical pathology
diagnostic_method_quote: Both highresolution CT (HRCT) and routine contrast-enhanced chest CT were obtained...Fiberoptic bronchoscopy was performed with cytologic examination...A right upper lobectomy was performed
imaging_findings: 2-cm spiculated nodule in right upper lobe with inhomogeneous enhancement and irregular border, surrounded by ground-glass opacity. Multiple tiny nodules (1-3mm) of ground-glass attenuation in right upper lobe with random distribution but peripheral tendency.
imaging_findings_quote: The nodule was seen in the right upper lobe and showed inhomogeneous enhancement and an irregular border with fine spiculation. The nodule was surrounded by a zone of ground-glass opacity...tiny nodules of ground-glass (1-3 mm in diameter) attenuation in the right upper lobe
histopathology: Well-differentiated adenocarcinoma (papillary subtype) and minute pulmonary meningothelial-like nodules (MPMNs). MPMNs showed cellular proliferations of meningothelial-like cells with round to oval nuclei and indistinct cell borders, associated with venules, expanding alveolar walls with stromal fibrosis.
histopathology_quote: diagnosis of the main tumor was well-differentiated adenocarcinoma, papillary subtype...These lesions consisted of cellular proliferations of meningothelial-like cells with round to oval nuclei and indistinct cell borders associated with venules, which expanded the alveolar walls and were accompanied by stromal fibrosis.
immunohistochemistry: Historical findings report MPMNs are immunoreactive for EMA, vimentin, myosin and negative for cytokeratin, S-100 protein, neuron-specific enolase, and actin
immunohistochemistry_quote: Gaffey et al. (2) reported that meningothelial-like nodules were immunoreactive for epithelial membrane antigen (EMA) and vimentin and were negative for cytokeratin, S-100 protein, neuron-specific enolase, and actin
treatment_quote: A right upper lobectomy was performed with the assumption that the patient had stage IA (T1N0M0) lung cancer
outcome: Stable - no change in remaining nodules at 12 months follow-up
outcome_quote: The lesions showed no change in morphologic characteristics of the ground-glass nodules...they were stable for an additional 6-month period
comorbidities_quote: We describe a patient with MPMNs and adenocarcinoma of the lung
filename: Kuroki et al. - 2002 - Minute Pulmonary Meningothelial-like Nodules High-Resolution Computed Tomography and Pathologic Cor.pdf
extraction_notes: The case is well-documented with clear clinical, imaging, and pathological findings. The only uncertainty relates to specific immunohistochemistry results for this particular case, as the IHC findings quoted are from historical studies rather than this specific patient.

presenting_symptoms_quote: presented for incidentally discovered pulmonary nodules... she denied any respiratory complaints including dyspnea, cough or sputum production
diagnostic_method_quote: transbronchial biopsies revealed many meningothelial like bodies confirming the diagnosis of Diffuse Pulmonary Meningotheliomatosis
imaging_findings: innumerable and diffusely distributed nodules up to 4mm in a military type pattern, no mediastinal or hilar adenopathy
imaging_findings_quote: The Computed Tomography (CT) scan of the chest with contrast showed innumerable and diffusely distributed nodules up to 4mm in a military type pattern. There was no mediastinal or hilar adenopathy
histopathology_quote: transbronchial biopsies revealed many meningothelial like bodies confirming the diagnosis of Diffuse Pulmonary Meningotheliomatosis
outcome_quote: Positron Emission Tomography/Computed Tomography (PET/CT) scan of our patient did not reveal abnormalities suggestive of underlying malignancy
comorbidities: 10 pack-year smoking history, occupational chemical fume exposure
comorbidities_quote: Medical, social and family history was remarkable for a 10 pack-year smoking history and occupational chemical fume exposure, working in a compounding pharmacy
filename: Gleason - 2016 - Meningotheliomatosis A Rare Cause of Diffuse Miliary Pattern Pulmonary Opacities.pdf
extraction_notes: The case is well-documented with clear presentation, diagnostic methods, and findings. The only uncertainty lies in treatment as it's not explicitly mentioned.
